title: IDOR while uploading ████ attachments at [█████████]
content:
Description:
There is an IDOR vulnerability in uploading attachments to the ████ section where an attacker can upload attachments in other user's █████████ if there is no attachment uploaded by a user. If this vulnerability will be used with a Race condition, it can allow an attacker to upload attachments in all-new █████████ created by users.
Impact
A user can upload attachments to other users ███.

Suggested Mitigation/Remediation Actions
steps: Go to the target website and log in.
Navigate to the section where attachments can be uploaded.
Create a new entry and upload an attachment, then submit it.
Capture the request in a tool like Burp Repeater.
Modify the request to change the user ID parameter to a victim's ID.
Send the modified request and observe the successful upload to the victim's section.
vuln_description: An Insecure Direct Object Reference (IDOR) vulnerability allows an attacker to upload attachments to other users' sections if those users have not yet uploaded any attachments. When combined with a race condition, this could enable mass exploitation across new user entries.
reason: The vulnerability involves understanding the IDOR flaw and the potential for race condition exploitation, but the steps to reproduce are straightforward once the parameter manipulation is identified.

authnz_metadata.reason: The IDOR vulnerability involves swapping resource_ids (user IDs) in the attachment upload functionality, which is covered by the methodology's test e) (substituting resource_ids with existing ones). The race condition aspect would require additional timing analysis but the core IDOR is detectable.
